history.content:
I took 151 (FPGA) with 123 last semester, and it can definitely get heavy by the end of the semester. 123 also has a final project, and though it's nowhere near as intense as 151, it's still nontrivial. If you're going for that specific combination, I'd be hesitant about taking a third technical with that (I'm not sure what the load of 113 is) - 123+151 will stretch you but is manageable, but a third might put you over the top.

The average workload for 123 usually entails a pset and a lab every week adding up to about 10 hours outside class, so it's definitely more work than, say, 120. It feels fairly similar to 128 thus far, if you've taken that. I should also mention that 123 is an incredibly rewarding class with Lustig, and 151 is very rewarding in general, and while I felt stretched pretty thin I'm very glad I took both classes.

I took 151 (FPGA) with 123 last semester, and it can definitely get heavy by the end of the semester. 123 also has a final project, and though it's nowhere near as intense as 151, it's still nontrivial. If you're going for that specific combination, I'd be hesitant about taking a third technical with that (I'm not sure what the load of 113 is) - 123+151 will stretch you but is manageable, but a third might put you over the top.

Someone asked a similar question almost a year ago but got no response.

I'm thinking of taking EE123 (Lustig) along with EECS151 (Wawrzynek)+Lab next semester, and I know that 151 is extremely time consuming, so I'm wondering how the workload of 123 is.  What common EE/CS classes would you say have a comparable workload to 123?  Also, for context, I have all the pre-reqs satisfied for these two classes, so that's not a concern. 

Current plan: EECS151+ASIC lab, EE123, and EE113 (not 100% sure about this one though).

Edit: I have the option to take 123 P/NP, would anyone recommend that? I guess that would lighten the load of 123.
history.subject: Workload of EE123
